unnormalised: Delhi: The Delhi High Court has issued a notice to several e-commerce platforms regarding the sale of counterfeit goods, especially those violating trademarks under Intellectual Property Law. Apparently, Adv. Sharma representing a leading textile company, filed a case citing massive losses due to these fake products.
normalised: Delhi: The Delhi High Court has issued a notice to several e-commerce platforms regarding the sale of counterfeit goods, especially those violating trademarks under Intellectual Property Law. Apparently, Advocate Sharma representing a leading textile company, filed a case citing massive losses due to these fake products.

unnormalised: The court, in its initial observation on 10/11/2024, expressed concern over the widespread availability of these items. Like, you could find knock-offs of almost any brand these days! The textile company, known for its intricate saree designs, reported a loss of approximately ₹20,00,000 in the last quarter alone – a direct consequence of the rampant sale of its copied designs on platforms like ShopLocal and QuickDeals.
